meanings.definition: Relating to the permissible combinations of phonemes in a particular language.
meanings.sent1: The phonotactic rules in English dictate which sounds can go together in words.
meanings.sent2: It is important to understand the phonotactic structure of a language when learning to speak it.
meanings.sent3: The phonotactic restrictions in this language make it tricky to pronounce some words.
meanings.sent4: The phonotactic boundaries of the language were like a fence, keeping certain sounds apart.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a fun game to help students remember the phonotactic rules of the language.

meanings.definition: Following the rules governing the permissible sequences of sounds in a language.
meanings.sent1: She carefully followed the phonotactic patterns while practicing her pronunciation.
meanings.sent2: Understanding the phonotactic rules is essential for clear communication.
meanings.sent3: The phonotactic order of sounds in this language is quite fascinating.
meanings.sent4: His speech followed a strict phonotactic structure, making it easy to understand.
meanings.sent5: The phonotactic guidelines helped her improve her accent and fluency in the language.
